{
    "number": 305557,
    "data": "1,1,1,2,2,3,4,5,5,6,6,6,6,6,7,7,7,8,9,9,10,11,11,12,13,14,15,16,16,17,17,18,19,19,19,20,20,21,21,21,22,22,22,22,23,23,24,24,24,24,24,24,25,25,25,26,26,26,26,27,28,28,28,28,29,29,30,31,31,32,33,33,33,33,34,35,36,37,37",
    "name": "a(1) = a(2) = 1; a(n) = n - a(a(n-2)) - a(n-a(n-2)) for n > 2.",
    "comment": [
        "Let a_i(n) = n - a_i(a_i(n-i)) - a_i(n-a_i(n-i)). This sequence is generated by a_2(n) with initial conditions 1, 1."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Altug Alkan, <a href=\"/A305557/a305557.pdf\">Proof of basic property</a>"
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n+1) - a(n) = 0 or 1 for all n >= 1 and a(n) hits every positive integer."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "a:=proc(n) option remember: if n<3 then 1 else n-procname(procname(n-2))-procname(n-procname(n-2)) fi; end: seq(a(n), n=1..100); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Jun 26 2018"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) a=vector(99); a[1]=a[2]=1; for(n=3, #a, a[n] = n-a[a[n-2]]-a[n-a[n-2]]); a",
        "(GAP) a:=[1,1];; for n in [3..100] do a[n]:=n-a[a[n-2]]-a[n-a[n-2]]; od; a; # _Muniru A Asiru_, Jun 26 2018"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A005229, A287422, A305845."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "1,4",
    "author": "_Altug Alkan_, Jun 21 2018",
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 18,
    "time": "2018-06-26T13:08:43-04:00",
    "created": "2018-06-26T13:08:43-04:00"
}
